input.document: Patient is a 58-year-old male with history of hypertension and diabetes. Presented with chest pain. Troponin elevated. ECG shows ST depressions. Treatment started with aspirin and beta blocker.

output.summary: 58-year-old male with HTN/DM presented with chest pain; elevated troponin and ST depressions. Started on aspirin and beta-blocker.

input.document: 37-year-old female with fever, cough, and dyspnea for 3 days. Chest X-ray shows right lower lobe consolidation. Antibiotics initiated.

output.summary: 37-year-old female with pneumonia (RLL consolidation) treated with antibiotics.
